Yes! You can get it on amazon! Biolage Scalpsync Anti-Dandruff Shampoo, 33.8 Fl Oz https://www.amazon.com/dp/B002DYCUW2/ref=cm_sw_r_cp_api_i_Uay-Db5B0RZKD


They have 2 different kinds so make sure you get this kind! It is pricey for shampoo but it‚Äôs totally worth it and each bottle typically lasts me 6 months. I would say it took at least four months for the plaque psoriasis to go away so it takes time! I know everyone‚Äôs psoriasis is different so hopefully this helps!!

I had super bad plaque psoriasis in my scalp for two years. I still have it but it‚Äôs not plaque anymore at all. I swear by Matrix scalpsync shampoo they have conditioner as well. I started using it because my hair salon lady told me about it. After a year of using it, it has helped tremendously. I still have psoriasis but my scalp is not constantly in pain and itching 24/7 it‚Äôs finally bearable. I would recommend trying it, it did take awhile for it to help though!

Me trying to make friends

You‚Äôre welcome! And you aren‚Äôt being melodramatic! Unfortunately for some people however don‚Äôt believe in depression or don‚Äôt understand how horrible of a disorder depression is. You should really sit down with them and just explain I‚Äôve done that with a few friends and they have been so understanding! I completely understand I hate getting close to people because all of my negative thoughts and being so sensitive. If I were you I would concentrate on the relationships you have now and open up to them. While you get better and are not as depressed looking to build other relationships then may help you. I really hope the best for you! You‚Äôre doing great! Be proud of how far you have come and never give up! I‚Äôm so sorry you are struggling.

You should try explain to your friends that this is part of having a mental illness. They should be understanding and comforting. I bail on friends all the time because of my anxiety and depression. It‚Äôs hard for people to understand but if they really care for you and love you they will stand by you and help you through your healing process even if you can‚Äôt be present. I‚Äôve struggled with the same thing and that is why I don‚Äôt have a lot of friends.
